pullrequest.title: added base_footprint, tighter amcl config, and better rviz config

content.raw:
I updated this branch again. I ended up not using a separate map for amcl and the static map of the costmap, because it didn't end up making much a difference once you consider the shadow the rolling chairs and the computers on the desks, which the robot can see.

If I had more time I'd try hector_mapping or amcl + scan matching for odom-less localization, and also try out TEB local planner, but it's working pretty well atm. It can navigate across the building most times and make it through doors as well, though I think in the cafe there is something strange with the traction of the robot, it seems to be commanding it to turn a lot but the robot sort of strafes forward and sideways instead.

It can still get lost if AMCL looses track of where it is when bumping into something and it can still get stuck when a goal is "inside an obstacle" due to drifting localization.
